description: Random field events tied to specific regions and roles with branching consequences

issues.title: Muskeg Subsidence on Haul Route
issues.description: A warm spell is softening peatland crossings along your mainline north of the Peace River, and loaded trucks are starting to break through.

options.label: Corduroy the approaches and reduce axle loads
options.outcome: Crews spend two days laying corduroy mats and instituting lighter loads. Production slows but you keep the haul alive.

options.label: Reroute across higher ridge ground
options.outcome: You pivot to a longer ridge alignment. It avoids damage yet demands extra engineering checks.

options.label: Suspend hauling until freeze-up
options.outcome: Operations pause entirely. Communities appreciate the caution while the mill scrambles for fibre.

issues.title: Caribou Maternal Pen Closure
issues.description: The province issues an emergency access restriction around a caribou maternal pen overlapping your BWBS and SWB tenure.

options.label: Shift development to alternate watersheds
options.outcome: You relocate effort to adjacent drainages. Stakeholders applaud but contractors face idle periods.

options.label: Negotiate limited access windows with guardians
options.outcome: A co-developed schedule allows short hauling windows with Indigenous monitors on site.

options.label: Challenge the order citing economic hardship
options.outcome: An appeal buys you time but strains relationships across the table.

issues.title: Cultural Burning Collaboration
issues.description: Lheidli T'enneh firekeepers request support for a cultural burn on SBS interface blocks to reduce ladder fuels before summer.

options.label: Fund planning and integrate burn objectives
options.outcome: You supply burn plans, crews, and monitoring. The collaboration deepens trust and improves stand resilience.

options.label: Decline citing risk and resource limits
options.outcome: You keep focus on conventional treatments. Partners view the response as dismissive.

options.label: Refer to BC Wildfire Service to lead
options.outcome: BCWS agrees to facilitate under strict conditions. The burn proceeds cautiously with moderate relationship gains.

issues.title: Salmon Crossing Washout
issues.description: An atmospheric river scours a fish-bearing creek along your Skeena access road, leaving gear stranded beyond the washout.

options.label: Install a temporary Bailey bridge with habitat oversight
options.outcome: Engineers and biologists fast-track a modular bridge. It's costly but keeps the salmon channel stable.

options.label: Suspend hauling and reroute to higher ground
options.outcome: You leave equipment in place and develop a ridge detour. Contractors grumble, yet communities commend the patience.

options.label: Helicopter sling high-value loads
options.outcome: Critical gear is flown out to resume production elsewhere, draining contingency funds.

issues.title: Persistent Smoke Inversion
issues.description: Wildfires to the south trap smoke over the SBS plateau, pushing particulate levels past safe work thresholds for a week.

options.label: Move crews to remote sensing and planning tasks
options.outcome: You pivot to mapping, data entry, and equipment maintenance until the inversion breaks.

options.label: Maintain field work with respirators and hazard pay
options.outcome: Productivity stays high but morale drops and WorkSafeBC raises concerns.

issues.title: Spruce Budworm Expansion
issues.description: Budworm egg masses appear across SBS regeneration blocks, threatening next year's survival counts.

options.label: Deploy aerial BtK treatments on priority polygons
options.outcome: You charter aircraft for targeted spraying, stemming the outbreak with regulator support.

options.label: Adjust stocking standards and species mix
options.outcome: You amend prescriptions to diversify species resilience, lowering immediate survival targets.

options.label: Monitor and hope for natural predators
options.outcome: Monitoring costs stay low, yet defoliation expands and auditors flag the passive stance.

issues.title: Ice Road Window Collapsing
issues.description: Mid-winter rain threatens to close the ice bridge supplying your BWBS camp for the rest of the season.

options.label: Accelerate hauling with double shifts
options.outcome: Crews push through long hours to move inventory before thaw. Wear and tear increases, but quotas are met.

options.label: Stage loads and wait for re-freeze
options.outcome: You secure landings and pause hauling. Expenses climb while you safeguard the corridor.

options.label: Truck via distant all-weather route
options.outcome: A 300 km detour keeps fibre flowing but hammers your budget and schedules.

issues.title: Karst Cave Discovery
issues.description: A reconnaissance crew in the Skeena-Nass plateau uncovers a karst cave with cultural features in the planned cutblock.

options.label: Commission karst and cultural inventories
options.outcome: Specialists map subterranean passages alongside Indigenous knowledge keepers, leading to a major redesign.

options.label: Flag a reserve and proceed with buffers
options.outcome: You set aside the cave feature with generous buffers. Regulators caution that monitoring must continue.

options.label: Harvest around the feature with minimal change
options.outcome: Operations continue with narrow setbacks. Guardians question the protection level.

issues.title: Community Water Turbidity Warning
issues.description: Smithers issues a turbidity advisory downstream of your interface road maintenance work.

options.label: Install sediment socks and continuous monitoring
options.outcome: You bring in hydrotech crews, install treatment, and share live data with the community.

options.label: Pause work and co-author a mitigation plan
options.outcome: Joint field walks develop long-term prescriptions. Schedule impacts mount, but trust rebounds strongly.

options.label: Dispute the readings and continue
options.outcome: You question data quality and push ahead. Officials warn that enforcement is imminent.

issues.title: Glacial Outburst Watch
issues.description: Hydrometric crews detect rising risk of a j√∂kulhlaup on the Stikine headwaters below your SWB operations.

options.label: Evacuate valley crews and redesign drainage
options.outcome: You pull teams back and invest in terrain stability modelling before re-entry.

options.label: Install remote sensors and keep skeleton crews
options.outcome: Monitoring arrays provide lead time while limited operations continue cautiously.

options.label: Accept the low probability and stay the course
options.outcome: Productivity remains high, yet emergency planners flag your risk tolerance.

issues.title: Heat Dome Sparks Extreme Fire Behaviour
issues.description: Temperatures hit record highs and fine fuels are flashing to torch height within minutes of ignition.

options.label: Suspend operations and cut fuel breaks with Nations
options.outcome: You stand down machinery and co-create shaded fuel breaks. Communities appreciate the caution.

options.label: Shift to night operations with heavy patrols
options.outcome: Crews work graveyards chasing cooler temps. Productivity holds but fatigue and risk climb.

options.label: Stage sprinkler protection and keep priority blocks running
options.outcome: You install pump protection with BCWS support, balancing risk reduction with production.

issues.title: Key Contractor Bankruptcy
issues.description: A long-time road builder files for bankruptcy, leaving projects mid-stream.

options.label: Absorb crews into company operations
options.outcome: You hire the core crew directly, stabilizing delivery but expanding payroll.

options.label: Rebid projects to other contractors
options.outcome: New bidders take time to mobilize, delaying schedules but protecting capital.

options.label: Pause worksites and renegotiate scope
options.outcome: You shrink the program, frustrating mills yet avoiding risk.

issues.title: Labour Job Action Threatened
issues.description: Union stewards demand revised safety provisions or threaten a strategic slowdown before fall surge.

options.label: Co-develop a refreshed safety charter
options.outcome: You spend two weeks negotiating safeguards and joint inspections, averting the slowdown.

options.label: Offer bonuses to keep the season moving
options.outcome: You buy short-term peace yet signal safety takes a backseat to quotas.

options.label: Call the bluff and prepare replacement crews
options.outcome: Replacement hires arrive but community sentiment cools dramatically.

issues.title: Lumber Market Crash
issues.description: North American lumber prices tank overnight, forcing difficult decisions about volume commitments.

options.label: Throttle harvest and preserve cash
options.outcome: You slow felling plans and protect balance sheets. Contractors brace for lean months.

options.label: Run full tilt to chase mill utilization
options.outcome: You keep production high to maintain market share, burning through reserves.

options.label: Pivot to value-added community contracts
options.outcome: You retool output toward specialty orders with local partners, stabilizing some revenue.

chained_issues.title: Mountain Pine Beetle Scouts Detected
chained_issues.description: Beetles are surfacing on the fringe of your SBS salvage recovery units. Entomologists warn an outbreak could reignite.

options.label: Launch sanitation crews immediately
options.outcome: You fall trap-trees and chip hotspots, buying valuable time against the beetles.

options.label: Monitor with pheromone traps for a season
options.outcome: You collect data before committing funds. Scientists caution that action will be needed soon.

options.label: Hold budgets for now and hope cold snaps arrive
options.outcome: You bank on weather doing the work. Neighbours question the hands-off approach.

chained_issues.title: Beetle Flights Intensify
chained_issues.description: Trap data shows beetle flights tripled. Adjacent licensees report mortality creeping toward their stands.

options.label: Fund aerial surveys and joint response now
options.outcome: You coordinate aerial sweep maps, sharing intel region-wide to contain spread.

options.label: Prioritize salvage volume while it lasts
options.outcome: You swing crews into salvage blitzes, drawing criticism for short-term thinking.

chained_issues.title: Regional Beetle Spillover
chained_issues.description: Adjacent operations suffer outbreaks traced to your tenure, straining cross-license relationships.

options.label: Lead a regional emergency summit
options.outcome: You convene peers, Nations, and government to rebuild trust and align salvage plans.

options.label: Offer stumpage credits to impacted neighbours
options.outcome: Credits soften the blow but dent your financial outlook.

options.label: Downplay the link and stay focused internally
options.outcome: You dispute the attribution. Collaboration fractures and oversight increases.
